meta.title: Home - New Hanover County Schools

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2 defaultDistrict

li.a: Series 1000 - School Board Governance and Operations
Career Readiness Academy at Mosley PLC
Travel Tracker - Go to Staff Portal
Career Readiness Academy at Mosley PLC

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow homepage-slideshow fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

figcaption.h3: The Wheels on the Bus Go Round and Round
figcaption.p: Though students were on Spring Break, NHCS staff remained committed to delivering meals and feeding as many youth as possible.

New Hanover County Board of Education is searching for the next Superintendent. Community input surveys on the qualities you think the next Superintendent should have can be found here Superintendent Search English and here Superintendent Search Spanish.

figcaption.h3: Your School News with Brandon Shope
figcaption.p: New Hanover County Schools Public Relations Division provides a recap of the past week’s events with Your School News.
NHCS has provided over 2,300 devices to students in the district to continue instructional learning. Still need one? Contact your school now.
Thank you to all our Assistant Principals for your continued dedication and commitment to the students of New Hanover County Schools.
Child Nutrition staff work to prepare and send out meals to students throughout the district.
CTE teachers at Ashley High School put district 3D printers to good use making face shields for New Hanover County emergency management.
NHCS staff are taking all safety precautions while working. Face masks and gloves have been provided for all employees working to distribute meals through the district's free meal service program.

The next regular meeting will be held on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 at 5:30 p.m. The public has the option to view meetings remotely via live streaming on Roku, Apple TV and at NHCS-TV. NHCS-TV airs all recorded Board Meetings on their YouTube Page.

div.div: On March 23, 2020, Governor Roy Cooper announced an Executive Order that closes all North Carolina Public Schools until May 15, 2020.
